title: Executive Assistant to the CEO Job at CIG Motors Co. Limited
content:
CIG Motors Co. Limited has begun on a soft landing since 2013 following a pact signed with Guangzhou Automobile Group Co., Limited (GAC MOTOR) to establish and manage distribution network in Nigeria, Africa. The group, headquartered in Guangzhou China, launched business operation in Nigeria at the peak of Automobile boom based on Government advocacy for the production of brand new vehicles in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the CEO

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly experienced, detail-oriented, and proactive Executive Assistant (EA) to support our Chief Executive Officer in managing a dynamic schedule, internal and external communications, and strategic priorities.
	This role requires a trusted professional who can anticipate needs, coordinate complex schedules, and provide seamless support in a fast-paced environment.
	The ideal candidate must demonstrate a high level of professionalism, discretion, emotional intelligence, and the ability to work independently while managing competing priorities.


Key Responsibilities


	Proven experience in an Executive-level support role, ideally within a listed or large organisation.
	Confidence in liaising with senior directors, stakeholders, and their executive assistants.
	Flexibility to manage fluctuating workloads and shifting priorities.
	Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
	Strong team player with a collaborative mindset.
	High emotional intelligence with the ability to navigate sensitive situations.
	Advanced proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Excel.
	Ability to adapt quickly to changes with diplomacy and tact.
	Professionalism, integrity, and the ability to work under pressure.
	Outstanding organisational and multitasking abilities.
	Impeccable attention to detail and accuracy.
	Willingness to develop a deep understanding of the company and its ecosystem.
	Strategic thinker, able to connect individual tasks to the bigger picture.


Requirements


	4 - 5 years of Executive-level EA experience in a corporate or listed company.
	Comfortable interacting with senior directors and their assistants.
	Flexible and composed under varying workloads.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
	Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Initiative-driven, collaborative, and emotionally intelligent.
	Committed to confidentiality and handling of sensitive information.
	Analytical thinker with a problem-solving mindset.
	Detail-oriented with excellent proofreading and document preparation skills.
	Keen to understand business context and strategic implications of tasks.


Benefits


	Attractive.

title: Operations Manager (Mechanical Engineer) Job at Habrams Energy
content:
Habrams Energy offers you engineering, procurement, construction management, operations, and maintenance services for oil & gas projects in the Gulf of Guinea. We provide specialist solutions to international oil companies, marginal field operators, and service companies.

Our work ranges from retrofitting and de-bottlenecking to designing complete facilities â€“ with seamless transition from construction to operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager (Mechanical Engineer)

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Habrams Energy seeks a strategic Mechanical Engineer to serve as Operations Manager.
	This role oversees the execution and optimization of EPC projects, Operations & Maintenance (O&M) contracts, Equipment Installation, Fabrication, Personnel Outsourcing, and Project Procurement.
	The ideal candidate will drive project delivery excellence, maintain high QHSE standards, and support company profitability and growth.


Key Responsibilities
Project Planning & Execution:


	Develop and implement project execution strategies aligned with Habrams Energy’s business goals.
	Translate project wins into actionable delivery plans, ensuring efficient allocation and optimization of resources across all service lines.
	Identify and implement best practices to enhance project efficiency, productivity, and cost-effectiveness.
	Project Delivery (EPC, O&M, Fabrication, Installation, Procurement)
	Lead the delivery of EPC, O&M, fabrication, equipment installation, and procurement projects, ensuring adherence to technical specifications, schedules, budgets, and QHSE standards.
	Oversee the safe and efficient execution of mechanical works, including planned/predictive maintenance, shutdowns/turnarounds, and root cause analysis for failures.
	Supervise mechanical subcontractors and vendors, ensuring quality and performance align with project requirements.


Technical Personnel Provision (Outsourcing Service):


	Direct the provision and deployment of outsourced technical personnel for client projects, ensuring all personnel meet competency and certification requirements, perform to client expectations, and comply with company and client QHSE standards at client sites.


Quality, Health, Safety & Environment (QHSE):


	Champion a strong QHSE culture across all projects, ensuring compliance with company policies, industry codes, and international standards (ISO 9001, 14001, 45001; ASME, API, AWS, ASTM).
	Lead incident investigations, corrective actions, and proactive risk management at all project locations.


Project Financial Management & Cost Control:


	Develop and control project budgets, identify cost-saving opportunities, and ensure financial targets are met across the project portfolio.
	Monitor expenditures and optimize resource utilization for all projects.


Stakeholder Management:


	Maintain strong relationships with clients, vendors, subcontractors, and regulatory agencies.
	Represent Habrams Energy in operational discussions, project negotiations, and post-project reviews.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Project Delivery Performance
	On-time project completion rate
	Within-budget project delivery rate
	Project scope adherence/client satisfaction
	Project profitability margin
	Project Quality & Efficiency
	Fabrication quality acceptance rate (first-pass yield)
	Installation quality index (re-work rate, punch list closure)
	Project efficiency metrics (e.g., man-hours per activity, equipment utilization)
	Project QHSE Performance
	Lost time incident rate (LTIR)/Total recordable incident rate (TRIR)—target zero
	Safety compliance audit scores
	Quality non-conformance rate (project-specific defects)
	Project Resource & Personnel Management
	Resource utilization rate (personnel/equipment)
	Personnel competency/certification rate for outsourced and internal teams
	Client Satisfaction
	Project-specific client satisfaction scores
	Repeat business rate.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering
	Minimum 10+ years of progressive project management experience in Oil & Gas, including at least 3 years in a senior project/operations leadership role.
	Proven track record managing EPC, O&M, fabrication, installation, and procurement projects.
	Deep understanding of industry codes and standards (ASME, API, AWS, ASTM).
	Strong QHSE leadership and compliance experience.
	Proficiency with project management methodologies and tools (PMP or equivalent required).
	Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Demonstrated ability to manage multiple project priorities in a dynamic environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Hea.recruitment@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
